thread.title: BAFTAS 2017: Hugh Grant sides with Meryl Streep against President Donald Trump’s outburst
thread.title_full: BAFTAS 2017: Hugh Grant sides with Meryl Streep against President Donald Trump’s outburst

title: BAFTAS 2017: Hugh Grant sides with Meryl Streep against President Donald Trump’s outburst
text:
BAFTAS 2017: Hugh Grant sides with Meryl Streep against President Donald Trump’s outburst BAFTAS 2017: Hugh Grant sides with Meryl Streep against President Donald Trump’s outburst HUGH GRANT has hit back at US President Donald Trump in support of his fellow film star Meryl Streep. PUBLISHED: 21:37,  56, Sun, Feb 12, 2017 GETTY Hugh Grant has defended Meryl Streep against Donald Trump's comments 
Slamming Trump’s comments in which the president branded Streep “one of the most overrated actresses in Hollywood” , Grant said he disagreed with the remarks. 
Referring to Donald Trump ’s cameo in the film Two Weeks Notice, Grant said: “No, I disagree with my other co-star Donald Trump. 
“It’s like watching Leonardo Da Vinci paint or something. She is just really, really good. I would say sort of possessed by the role, so almost like something from the exorcist.” Related articles BAFTAs 2017: Meryl Streep 'overrated'! Stephen Fry echoes Trump dig 
The 56-year-old actor also revealed at the BAFTAs that he is terrified and frightened when filming with Streep because of her professional acting skills. 
“Of course, especially the big emotional scenes. I’m frightened of those anyway, you know, the greatest actress in the country,” he added. 
The support came after 70-year-old Trump unleashed a series of tweets before his inauguration, attacking 67-year-old Streep in response to her criticism of him at the Golden Globes. GETTY Hugh Grant and Meryl Streep starred together in Florence Foster Jenkins GETTY Hugh Grant has defended Meryl Streep at the BAFTAs 2017 BAFTAs 2017: The award winners Sun, February 12, 2017
